channel.title: Maths... confusing me!
channel.description:
A9543B represents a six-digit number in which A and B are digits different from each other. The number is divisible by 11 and also by 8.
What digit does A represent?
Since the number is divisible by 8, the number 43B formed by the last three digits of the given number is divisible by 8. Digit B must be 2.
Since A95432 is divisible by 11, the difference between the sum of its odd-place digits and the sum of its even-place digits is 0 or a multiple of 11. In this case, the difference is 0. Then (A+5+3)-(9+4+2)=0 is equivalent to A+8=15 or A=7.
B=2 A=7
but i dont know if that is correct but i had to give it a go before i put it down as my answer i need to make sure!

item.title: Maths... confusing me!

item.description:
@Tranquil wrote:

A9543B represents a six-digit number in which A and B are digits different from each other. The number is divisible by 11 and also by 8.

What digit does A represent?

Since the number is divisible by 8, the number 43B formed by the last three digits of the given number is divisible by 8. Digit B must be 2.

Since A95432 is divisible by 11, the difference between the sum of its odd-place digits and the sum of its even-place digits is 0 or a multiple of 11. In this case, the difference is 0. Then (A+5+3)-(9+4+2)=0 is equivalent to A+8=15 or A=7.

B=2
A=7
